page.title: 03A Local Farmer
page.content: Four generations of Mr.Ayres' family have lived on the farm.He has worked on the farm for 17 years.The farm has 8 sheds, a new farmhouse and a medium size milking parlour.The farm has 185 cows and 1100 sheep and lambs.The cows produce about 1800 litres of milk aday.It takes 2 hours to milk the cows which are Friesans.They make silage twice a year but grow no other crops. A student and a part-time worker are employed on the farm.They earn about Â£3 an hour. The family have two children,4sheep dogs and 1Terrier.They go on holiday about once every 5 years.They enjoy living on the farm. When the weather is cold they put their animals inside and feed them on silage and cake eventhough they have 280 acres. Hannah Turner and Clare Hale
